intro: Mollinedia roraimensis, commonly known as the Roraima mollinedia, is a flowering plant native to the tepuis of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky, nutrient-poor soils at high elevations. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a waxy coating, which helps reduce water loss in its arid environment. Due to its limited distribution and unique appearance, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
